subject: Photography
title: Photography and Impermanence
description: Learn Photography and Impermanence in one minute.

hook.text: A photograph captures a moment that will never repeat. Every image is proof that time only moves forward.

buildup.text: Photography is fundamentally about impermanence ‚Äî freezing moments that are already gone the instant they happen.

discovery.text: This is why photographs of departed loved ones carry such weight. The image is all that remains of that moment.

twist.text: Digital photography's abundance may dilute this meaning. When you take ten thousand photos a year, each one means less.

climax.text: The awareness that everything is temporary gives photography its emotional power. Freezing time is an act of love.

punchline.text: Every photo protests time. You can't stop it. But you can hold one moment.

quiz.question: Why does impermanence give photography its emotional power?
options: Freezing moments that can never repeat creates a powerful connection to what's been lost
Permanent things are more interesting to photograph
Digital photos last forever so impermanence is irrelevant
